subject: Re: [junit] Why no assertNotEquals()?
msgSnippet: No good reason. It just wasn t built. The solution is to roll your own or use a standard extension like JUnit-addons. If Vladimir doesn t have it, then bug him

No good reason. It just wasn't built.

The solution is to roll your own or =
use a standard extension like JUnit-addons. If Vladimir doesn't have it, th=
en bug him to add it.

For example, GSBase's BaseTestCase replace "assertSa=
me()" with a better failure message.

Take care.

>So said Leeuw van der, T=
im on 2003-06-24 --------------------
>Hi,
>
>I don't know if this is a FAQ=
; didn't find it in the FAQ questions. But why
>is there no assertNotEquals=
? In writing testcases for custom equals()
>functions I often need to test =
that 2 different instances return false for
>the equals() operator, so I oc=
casionally have a need for such a method.
>
>Regards,
